subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Social Franchising: Copying What Works
description: A quick win: understand Social Franchising: Copying What Works.

hook.text: McDonald's proved franchising scales fast food. Social entrepreneurs asked: why not scale social impact?

buildup.text: Social franchises replicate proven programs across regions using a standard playbook and shared brand.

discovery.text: VisionSpring trained local entrepreneurs in 20 countries to sell affordable eyeglasses to the poor.

twist.text: Unlike fast food, social franchises must balance strict quality control with deep community ownership.

climax.text: VisionSpring sold over 8 million pairs of glasses. Each franchisee earns income while restoring sight.

punchline.text: The best ideas don't need reinventingâ€”just replicating.

quiz.question: What is social franchising?
options: A government program that licenses charities to operate in specific regions
Replicating proven social programs across regions using a standardized model
A type of fast food restaurant that donates all profits to charity
